headshotImage.caption: Dushmantha Chameera player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dushmantha Chameera player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Nabi lbw b Chameera 23 (23b 2x4 0x6 45m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Huge appeal for lbw and given! Nabi reviews instantly. This one was a good length on off, nipping in. It goes past the inside edge and strikes the front pad on middle and leg. The question is both of height, and whether this is clipping leg. And yes, it's the most marginal off calls, as this is shown to be barely clipping the top of leg stump. Worthwhile review, but Nabi has to go! Afghanistan folding fast here, can they string together any kind of stand?

headshotImage.longCaption: Ibrahim Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ibrahim Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Lahiru Kumara player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lahiru Kumara player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ibrahim Zadran b Kumara 22 (21b 4x4 0x6 45m) SR: 104.76

dismissalComment.html: And Kumara gets the big one! This was on a good length outside off, but nips in sharply. Ibrahim's foot movement lets him down here, as he leaves a big gap between bat and pad on the drive. The movement off the surface catches the inside edge and it crashes on to the stumps. Afghanistan in quite a bit of a trouble here.

headshotImage.caption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Shah nicks it through! This was short and wide, not a great delivery by any means, but Shah is very loose on this cut and gets a feather through to the keeper.

headshotImage.caption: Hashmatullah Shahidi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Hashmatullah Shahidi player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Strangles him down leg! Another soft scalp, but Sri Lanka won't complain. This was short of a length going down leg, but all Shahidi manages to do his feather this down leg where Mendis takes an excellent catch diving to his right

headshotImage.caption: Najibullah Zadran headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Najibullah Zadran headshot

dismissalComment.html: And fourth times the charm! This one was short of a length on the stumps, 141kph, pitching and straightening on Najibullah, who gets a leading edge that loops to Hasaranga at backward point for a simple take. Afghanistan are in a major trouble here.

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Nabi headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Nabi headshot

dismissalComment.html: Huge appeal for lbw and given! Nabi reviews instantly. This one was a good length on off, nipping in. It goes past the inside edge and strikes the front pad on middle and leg. The question is both of height, and whether this is clipping leg. And yes, it's the most marginal off calls, as this is shown to be barely clipping the top of leg stump. Worthwhile review, but Nabi has to go! Afghanistan folding fast here, can they string together any kind of stand?

headshotImage.caption: Wanindu Hasaranga player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Wanindu Hasaranga player page headshot cutout, 2021

images.caption: Wanindu Hasaranga looks unstoppable on dismissing Rashid Khan
images.longCaption: Wanindu Hasaranga looks unstoppable on dismissing Rashid Khan, Sri Lanka vs Afghanistan, 3rd ODI, Hambantota, June 7, 2023

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: And now he gets his man! This was another leg break on the stumps, and Rashid goes for the sweep but misses completely. This crashes into his back thigh and it's going nowhere else but onto the stumps.

headshotImage.caption: Mujeeb Ur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mujeeb Ur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: edged and taken! Afghanistan are eight down! Slowed up a touch on a length just outside off stump. Mujeeb is beaten in the flight and his feet do not move much either. He has a loose waft at it and feathers it through to Mendis, who snaffles up a smart chance! Mujeeb reviews, more in hope, though. UltraEdge comes up and shows that there is a small spike when the ball is close to the bat! Hasaranga has another!

headshotImage.caption: Fazalhaq Farooqi, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Fazalhaq Farooqi, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalComment.html: huge appeal, and given! But Farooqi wants to have another look at it! Googly fizzed through on a length on middle and off stump. Farooqi does not pick it and is caught on the crease. The bat gets nowhere close to the ball and he gets pinned on the back pad - right in front of the stumps. UltraEdge confirms that there is no bat involved, and Ball Tracking returns with three reds! That will be that for Afghanistan in this innings!

dismissalComment.html: And Gurbaz's poor run of form continues! Another one dug in short, and this time Gurbaz can't resist but going for the hook. He only manages to top edge it though and it's taken well by Dimuth Karunaratne at fine leg.

dismissalText.commentary: Pathum Nissanka lbw b Gulbadin Naib 51 (34b 8x4 2x6 44m) SR: 150

dismissalComment.html: Naib gets Nissanka! Full and slanted into middle and leg stump. Nissanka falls over just a touch and then plays all around it. The ball strikes him on the pads and the umpire has no hesitation in raising his finger. Nissanka, though, thinks this is going down leg and has reviewed! No bat involved and Ball Tracking shows that the ball would have thundered into leg stump. Nissanka has to go!

commentPreTextItems.html: Just two runs needed now. Can Karunaratne finish it off this ball?

commentTextItems.html: yes, he can, albeit with some help from the Afghanistan fielders! Sri Lanka win by nine wickets! Length delivery just outside off stump. Karunaratne plonks it into the off side. He then hesitates before eventually agreeing to the single. The fielder collects it and fires a throw at the bowler's end. No one is backing up, though, and the ball races away to the fence!

commentPostTextItems.html: And with that it's a wrap from us, and an end to a hard fought series, even if this last game was more one-sided than anyone could have imagined. Up next for Sri Lanka are the World Cup qualifiers in Zimbabwe starting in a little over a week, while Afghanistan will regroup ahead of a series against Bangladesh. But till then it's goodbye from us, on behalf of Shashwat and the rest of team, it's been a pleasure! Though don't go too far cos there's quite a bit of cricket left today, cos the small matter of the World Test Championship final will begin in less than an hour! So be sure to tune in for that.

Sri Lankan captain Dasun Shanaka: "After going down 1-0 in the series it was very special to wrap it up today. Dimuth has been outstanding over the last few years, so he has a lot more to offer Sri Lanka Cricket. These couple of games we played as a group, and showed exactly what we could do. Especially Chameera and Kumara how they started today, especially how the wicket was. They showed a lot of character, and I hope they will carry this on to the qualifiers."

Afghanistan captain Hashmatullah Shahidi: "Today was a bad day for our batters, but it happens in cricket. It was a good batting wicket, but we lost early wickets because of bad shot selection. We need to improve in our batting, we have a series with Bangladesh so we will work harder. Ibrahim has been doing very well in the past year, so I hope he continues. The positives were definitely Ibrahim and some of the bowlers as well."

Player of the Match and Player of the Series awards go to Dushmantha Chameera: "Feel happy to be back after surgery. I worked hard on my fitness and bowling. First match there was a little bit of pressure having played after 10 months, but I was okay after the first over and got into my rhythm."

Palinda: "Afganistan performance in the world cup should closely monitor and decide the future of world cup supee leauge. Most of times their opponent was an associate nation while others have bilateral series with rankings higher up the order. I think selection for the world cup should be done based on rankings." Don't think it's as much a problem with the Super League as much as it is with the current state of the future tours program.
Lots of parallel thinking regarding the timing of this finish.
nuka: "Did SL team plan this .Prefect timing now we can switch to ICC World Test Championship Final. "
Shamil Akbar: "Both teams wanted to finish the game quickly, in time for the World Test Championship finals!"
HMasoom: "Sri Lankan batters were in hurry to watch WTC Final" Ha! And the Afghan batters too, perhaps!

Thanks Shashwat, anti-climactic indeed! Biggest takeaway for the hosts has to be that Chameera looked to be gearing up close to his best. Keeping him fit will be crucial to any Sri Lankan hopes in the coming months. For Afghanistan, they showed what they were capable of in that first game, but as with Sri Lanka, consistency is key at this level.
Here is Madushka to take you through the post-match presentation!
1:41pm Wow, that was anti-climactic, not in terms of the result today but considering how this occasion was set up, with the series being deadlocked. Afghanistan never turned up; Sri Lanka did.

Nissanka was the star of the show in the second innings, scoring a 32-ball fifty. Karunaratne was at his serene best at the other end, notching up his second successive ODI half-century. Earlier in the day, Chameera picked up a four-wicket haul. Hasaranga bagged three as well, with Kumara being just as impressive with the new ball.

All in all, this was the perfect display that Sri Lanka would have asked for - almost all of their components functioned optimally today. As for Afghanistan, this is a day they would want to forget very quickly.

dismissalComment.html: And Kumara gets the big one! This was on a good length outside off, but nips in sharply. Afghanistan in quite a bit of a trouble here.

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Nabi lbw b Chameera 23 (23b 2x4 0x6 45m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Huge appeal for lbw and given! Nabi reviews instantly. This one was a good length on off, nipping in. It goes past the inside edge and strikes the front pad on middle and leg. The question is both of height, and whether this is clipping leg. And yes, it's the most marginal off calls, as this is shown to be barely clipping the top of leg stump. Worthwhile review, but Nabi has to go! Afghanistan folding fast here, can they string together any kind of stand?

dismissalComment.html: edged and taken! Afghanistan are eight down! Slowed up a touch on a length just outside off stump. Mujeeb is beaten in the flight and his feet do not move much either. He has a loose waft at it and feathers it through to Mendis, who snaffles up a smart chance! Mujeeb reviews, more in hope, though. dismissalText.commentary: Fazalhaq Farooqi lbw b PWH de Silva 4 (15b 1x4 0x6 27m) SR: 26.66

dismissalComment.html: huge appeal, and given! But Farooqi wants to have another look at it! Googly fizzed through on a length on middle and off stump. Farooqi does not pick it and is caught on the crease. The bat gets nowhere close to the ball and he gets pinned on the back pad - right in front of the stumps. UltraEdge confirms that there is no bat involved, and Ball Tracking returns with three reds! That will be that for Afghanistan in this innings!

dismissalText.commentary: Rahmat Shah c Mendis b Chameera 7 (11b 1x4 0x6 13m) SR: 63.63

dismissalComment.html: Shah nicks it through! This was short and wide, not a great delivery by any means, but Shah is very loose on this cut and gets a feather through to the keeper.

dismissalText.commentary: Hashmatullah Shahidi c Mendis b Chameera 4 (3b 1x4 0x6 2m) SR: 133.33

dismissalComment.html: Strangles him down leg! Another soft scalp, but Sri Lanka won't complain. This was short of a length going down leg, but all Shahidi manages to do his feather this down leg where Mendis takes an excellent catch diving to his right

dismissalText.commentary: Ibrahim Zadran b Kumara 22 (21b 4x4 0x6 45m) SR: 104.76

dismissalComment.html: And Kumara gets the big one! This was on a good length outside off, but nips in sharply. Ibrahim's foot movement lets him down here, as he leaves a big gap between bat and pad on the drive. The movement off the surface catches the inside edge and it crashes on to the stumps. Afghanistan in quite a bit of a trouble here.

dismissalText.long: c PWH de Silva b Chameera
dismissalText.commentary: Najibullah Zadran c PWH de Silva b Chameera 10 (13b 2x4 0x6 17m) SR: 76.92

dismissalComment.html: And fourth times the charm! This one was short of a length on the stumps, 141kph, pitching and straightening on Najibullah, who gets a leading edge that loops to Hasaranga at backward point for a simple take. Afghanistan are in a major trouble here.

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Nabi lbw b Chameera 23 (23b 2x4 0x6 45m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Huge appeal for lbw and given! Nabi reviews instantly. This one was a good length on off, nipping in. It goes past the inside edge and strikes the front pad on middle and leg. The question is both of height, and whether this is clipping leg. And yes, it's the most marginal off calls, as this is shown to be barely clipping the top of leg stump. Worthwhile review, but Nabi has to go! Afghanistan folding fast here, can they string together any kind of stand?

dismissalText.commentary: Rashid Khan lbw b PWH de Silva 2 (8b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: And now he gets his man! This was another leg break on the stumps, and Rashid goes for the sweep but misses completely. This crashes into his back thigh and it's going nowhere else but onto the stumps.

dismissalText.long: c Mendis b PWH de Silva
dismissalText.commentary: Mujeeb Ur Rahman c Mendis b PWH de Silva 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: edged and taken! Afghanistan are eight down! Slowed up a touch on a length just outside off stump. Mujeeb is beaten in the flight and his feet do not move much either. He has a loose waft at it and feathers it through to Mendis, who snaffles up a smart chance! Mujeeb reviews, more in hope, though. UltraEdge comes up and shows that there is a small spike when the ball is close to the bat! Hasaranga has another!

dismissalText.long: c DM de Silva b Theekshana
dismissalText.commentary: Gulbadin Naib c DM de Silva b Theekshana 20 (21b 4x4 0x6 40m) SR: 95.23

dismissalComment.html: holes out to long on! Theekshana has his first! Given a bit of air on a length outside off stump and it entices Naib into the slog. Gets down on one knee and mows at it but miscues it completely. The ball goes miles up into the air and when it comes down, Dhananjaya de Silva pouches it!

dismissalText.commentary: Fazalhaq Farooqi lbw b PWH de Silva 4 (15b 1x4 0x6 27m) SR: 26.66

dismissalComment.html: huge appeal, and given! But Farooqi wants to have another look at it! Googly fizzed through on a length on middle and off stump. Farooqi does not pick it and is caught on the crease. The bat gets nowhere close to the ball and he gets pinned on the back pad - right in front of the stumps. UltraEdge confirms that there is no bat involved, and Ball Tracking returns with three reds! That will be that for Afghanistan in this innings!

dismissalText.commentary: Pathum Nissanka lbw b Gulbadin Naib 51 (34b 8x4 2x6 44m) SR: 150

dismissalComment.html: Naib gets Nissanka! Full and slanted into middle and leg stump. Nissanka falls over just a touch and then plays all around it. The ball strikes him on the pads and the umpire has no hesitation in raising his finger. Nissanka, though, thinks this is going down leg and has reviewed! No bat involved and Ball Tracking shows that the ball would have thundered into leg stump. Nissanka has to go!
